thread.title: '3-0': How Hillary Clinton and the internet reacted to Donald Trump's travel ban defeat
thread.title_full: '3-0': How Hillary Clinton and the internet reacted to Donald Trump's travel ban defeat

author: Chris Graham
title: '3-0': How Hillary Clinton and the internet reacted to Donald Trump's travel ban defeat
text:
'3-0': How Hillary Clinton and the internet reacted to Donald Trump's travel ban defeat Hillary Clinton was quick to respond on Twitter to Donald Trump's travel ban defeat Credit: Reuters Chris Graham  35am 
D onald Trump was quick off the mark when he tweeted his reaction to the federal appeals court refusing to reinstate his travel ban, but his former rival Hillary Clinton was not far behind. 
The panel of three judges from the San Francisco-based 9th US Circuit Court of Appeals declined to block a lower-court ruling that suspended the ban and allowed previously barred travellers from seven predominantly Muslim nations to enter the US. 
Moments after the court's ruling , the president shouted on Twitter: "SEE YOU IN COURT, THE SECURITY OF OUR NATION IS AT STAKE!" 
The tweet provoked a frenzied response on social media, with users mocking his statement and use of Twitter. SEE YOU IN COURT, THE SECURITY OF OUR NATION IS AT STAKE! â€” Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 9, 2017 
T he former Democratic presidential candidate was succinct in her reply, choosing not to use caps, or indeed letters. "3-0," she tweeted, an apparent reference the 3-0 vote by the court. 
Mrs Clinton's response split opinion on Twitter. While some praised her, others pointed to her two presidential campaign defeats. â€” Metal Mofosâ„¢ (@MetalMofos) February 10, 2017 . @HillaryClinton You're 0-2 in presidential runs. ðŸ¤—ðŸ˜‚ â€” Asa J ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ (@asamjulian) February 10, 2017 
Other social media users weighed in on Mr Trump's response, especially his use of capital letters. Question: if it's true that Trump dictates his tweets, how does one specify ALL CAPS? Or is it an accurate representation of him yelling? â€” Sally Ann Kay (@mcsharhead) February 10, 2017 Now, this is a tweet. Trump take note: She did it with only 3 characters & no exclamation points or CAPS needed. https://t.co/jn3rCrH1AS â€” CIA Spy Girl (@CIAspygirl) February 10, 2017 THE TRUMP ADMINISTRATION'S LEGAL BRIEF SHOULD USE ALL CAPS AND EXCLAMATION POINTS TO UNDERSCORE THAT THE SECURITY OF OUR NATION IS AT STAKE! â€” Josh Greenman (@joshgreenman) February 10, 2017 Trump's Tweet shrewdly reflects little known Marbury v. Madison footnote: 'We take notice that ALL CAPS greatly strengthens any argument." â€” Jeff Greenfield (@greenfield64) February 10, 2017 
T he president's vow to "see you in court" after losing a court case also proved as talking point, with the American Civil Liberties Union quick to say they'd be happy to see him there. We have been saying this for a while. https://t.co/JFpVlTYUZm â€” ACLU National (@ACLU) February 10, 2017 "I'LL SEE YOU IN COURT!" is really the worst thing to yell after you just lost in court â€” Erin ðŸŽ¶GloriaðŸŽ¶ Ryan (@morninggloria) February 9, 2017 Shouting "I'LL SEE YOU IN COURT!" after losing in court feels like a classic Gene Wilder bit in a Mel Brooks movie â€” Psy Costanza (@J_Holla) February 10, 2017 Trump Tweeting I'LL SEE YOU IN COURT right after losing in court is like The Falcons telling Tom Brady post game WE"LL SEE YOU ON THE FIELD! â€” David Brody (@David_Brody) February 10, 2017 
A nd some high profile Democrats, including Eric Holder, the former US attorney general under President Obama, and US Senator Al Franken, were in such a rush to react, they didn't have time to check their spelling. Ecouraged by decision that questions constitutionality of @POTUS terrible EO. Hope it's soon struck down for good. https://t.co/Qc7oTCD58O â€” Sen. Al Franken (@SenFranken) February 10, 2017 Skill, judgment, courgage. VINDICATED. 3-0 pic.twitter.com/5A2uPTXRps â€” Eric Holder (@EricHolder) February 10, 2017
